description: Thanks author for this program!

I actually really like it. It seems to work quite well and actually looks great in plasma to me. I like how it sizes the window intially with intuitive offset lines. If only there were a shortcut key for reseting that to default after stretching. But still very easy to adjust back. Love the conversion tab. Nice job.

GHex is a nice, full-featured hex editor for the GNOME 2 desktop. It uses the latest GTK+, but it's still unquestionably a GNOME 2 interface, with many quirks (like the padding around all the contents of the window, including the menubar).  It hasn't seen any real development for years.  Overall, GHex could become a good hex editor for the modern GNOME desktop, but only if someone shows it some affection.
summary: Solid hex editor with an antique interface

description: It will do what you want but don't expect more the the name says.
It doesn't have some more advanced features of other hex edits like bless or wxhexeditor, but on the other hand this one actually works
summary: Great simple hex edit that just works

description: Just what I need for testing out my game's save files -- you read and edit, and that's all I need! (+1 for not hanging up or slowing my computer when I open it -- some software does this)

There was no demarcation between the address and the first byte of each line. I could not visually access the data fast enough given this oddity. Otherwise, looked like a good app. Ubuntu 19.05, 5.2.9 kernel
Very fast... does what it needs to
it just works and is grafical
summary: just what i was looking for

description: This is very good.
Would be better if you could copy + paste into the find window to find bytes copied external to the application.
Unlike the other "fancier" hex editors I tried first, this one actually works. Easily loaded and edited two files.

Whomever decided that it was a good idea to start making use of Flatpack as a software distribution mechanism should be censured. Using Fedora, at some point I selected GHex as a tool while working on some problem. As a result my system is out of free disk space and I am unable to update my OS, despite days of additional hacking. While GHex did not directly cause this issue, they could have released their software in an RPM or similar format in addition to supporting .deb. The world of LInux has changed so much in the past decades, and I'm not sure I like where it is going.
summary: Seems to be the only Flatpack on my Fedora install requiring 2.6 GB

description: The only way is zoom window width and then count the columns one by one. Even this works anyway, but limited to monitor's width.
summary: Can't set count of columns to fixed value: 8, 16, 32, 1K and so on

description: I cannot select all. Ctrl+a does nothing. Like what
summary: disappointed by absence of trivial feature

description:
If all you need is to view raw hex, it's fine. 

If you want to edit, it's horribly broken. Copying text is always off by one, you have to select one extra byte. It doesn't seem to be able to copy raw bytes at all. It doesn't paste over a selection you made, it always seems to insert it at the cursor instead.
summary: Only useful for inspection, not editing

description: I could not figure out in 15 minutes how to actually change the value of a given hex. that's the entire point of this program: to make that easy
I wanted to inspect memory dumps and I couldn't find a way to align the data in 8-bytes. The search functionality is also very difficult to use.
summary: Works to read data but searching is time consuming

description:
It can no longer be installed on Ubuntu 20.04. It works great in Ubuntu 12 and 16.  Apparently it is missing a bundle of dependencies. 

Depends: libgail-3-dev but it is not going to be installed
Depends: libgtk-3-dev but it is not going to be installed

Depends: gir1.2-gtk-3.0 (= 3.24.18-1ubuntu1) but 3.24.20-0ubuntu1.1 is to be installed
Depends: libatk-bridge2.0-dev but it is not going to be installed
Depends: libgtk-3-0 (= 3.24.18-1ubuntu1) but 3.24.20-0ubuntu1.1 

But this keeps on growing as you move down the list of missing dependencies.

Too bad I really need this tool.

Most of the existing review are outdated, even reviews as recent as 2022. It has a modern GTK 4 interface. It has seen a lot of recent improvements around selection, copy-paste, and insert mode vs edit mode. Give it a try!
This editor is fast, looks great, has a surprising number of features for a GNOME app ,and overall is a pleasure to use.
summary: Smooth, featureful, good looking hex editor

description: Works great and looks good while doing it.
GHex kann keine großen Dateien über 2 GiB verarbeiten. Es erscheint keine Fehlermeldung und die Dateien werden beim Speichern gestutzt.

copy paste is buggy which makes it pretty much unsuable
you can only open files you can not create a new one

Used it for years now, always my go to when I need to do ctfs or check binary files. It is a bit hard to get used to the weird way of copy/pasting, but it makes sense with a bit of practice. I would totally recommand.
summary: Simple but powerful, does what it needs to do perfectly

description: Что тут говорить? Хороший hex эдитор
Именно то, что я искал. Спасибо!

Приятный минимал-интерфейс, ни чего лишнего, в стиле GNOME. 
Для моих задач (просмотр файлов, редактирование, добавление данных) хватает за глаза...
Разработчикам - БОЛЬШОЕ СПАСИБО !
working as usual
很实用！非常好！
